result.execSummary:
The defendant DANIEL W POWLESS was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: -To commence immediately. Court grants the defendant 173 days of sentence credit.
-Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM Defendant DANIEL W POWLESS in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DANIEL W POWLESS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF33 & 2022CF36. Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to counts 1 in 2022CF33 with probation and conditions and will plea to count 2 with jail, costs and DNA sample and 2022CF36 will be dismissed and read-in. ADA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged on both counts in 2022CF33 and orders 2022CF36 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2022CF33 - Count 1

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 

2022CF33 - Count 2

-6 months county jail. To commence immediately. Court grants the defendant 173 days of sentence credit.
-Court costs. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 2:05 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:51 AM Defendant DANIEL W POWLESS in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for DANIEL W POWLESS.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF33 and 22CF36. Atty Kapelis states the defendant will be waiving his right to a prelim on each case. Def concurs - will waive right to prelim. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause for both cases. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court for both cases. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading for both cases. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty for both cases on behalf of the defendant. 

Court notes there is a request to modify bond for 22CF33. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond modification. Statement by ADA McElroy regarding bond modification. Court denies motion to modify bond. Court sets Return Date June 20, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:56 AM.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Second appearance on March 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:11 AM Defendant DANIEL W POWLESS appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF33 and 22CF36. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of both the criminal complaints and waives their readings. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count/case. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court notes bond has been set for 22CF33.   ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Defendant makes bond recommendation. For 22CF36 Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with Dean L or Dean A. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel for March 29, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:15 AM.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Daniel W. Powless appeared in custody, via zoom from the jail, Atty Michael Kapelis appeared by video for the defendant, DA Gerise Laspisa appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. Court has received the PC statement. DA Laspisa confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Statement by DA Laspisa states the victim has been in touch with her office and requests no contact. DA makes bond recommendation. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Court orders $5,000 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Dean L or Dean A. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court schedules Initial Appearance for March 8, 2022 at 9:00 AM.
